message.Summary: Delayed start of CID

message.Combined Comments:
2024-07-18 - 9:04 *LC/PM analysis done at UTC+5:30 *_x000D_
_x000D_
*Please note :- Logs taken from BRIAN path *_x000D_
_x000D_
After the Last STR successful from SOC and IOC side   _x000D_
_x000D_
Next wakeup around the error time is received as WUP KL30B HIGH or WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER   _x000D_
Hence  startup is delayed  I even checked the Brain path also  there are no BCP can traces   _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-07-18-12-58-00-201 png width=235 height=115!_x000D_
_x000D_
Could OSIS IOC team have a look here  why WUP KL30B HIGH or WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER is received  Thanks!_x000D_
_x000D_
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------_x000D_
_x000D_
//SOC side STR is successful _x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
2279209 2024/07/12 23:27:52 600180 930 8978 141 MGUL NSM SDMG 1026 log info verbose 6 Sending prepareShutdown with maximumStandbyTime(sec): 1123200 ShutdownType : SHUTDOWN_SUSPEND_TO_RAM functionalPartialNetworkMaskEthOn : noformat _x000D_
//IOC side  STR is successful _x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
4240 2024/07/12 23:27:52 580360 2064 3824 238 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [3] SHUTDOWN_SUSPEND_TO_RAM _x000D_
4247 2024/07/12 23:27:52 580360 2064 3923 245 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [14] Client:Lcm_Master- SoCMM request:STR_MODE- Status:IN_PROGRESS _x000D_
4337 2024/07/12 23:27:55 064005 2066 8537 79 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [13] SoCMM current state: STR_MODE _x000D_
4338 2024/07/12 23:27:55 064005 2066 8538 80 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [14] Client:Lcm_Master- SoCMM request:STR_MODE- Status:FINISHED _x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
//Next wakeup around the error time *12 07 2024 [22:17:31] (UTC + 2)  km*_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
4410 2024/07/13 01:47:15 635623 0 1098 60 IOC PMD   4101 log info non-verbose 0 [4] WUP KL30B HIGH _x000D_
4490 2024/07/13 01:47:16 137206 0 4371 140 IOC SMC   4097 log info non-verbose 0 [13] KL30B Status:<OK> _x000D_
4649 2024/07/13 01:47:18 150823 2 9306 44 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [2] WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER  noformat ;;;  From the IOC serial logs from BRIAN path _x000D_
_x000D_
The LCCounter is set to 399 _x000D_
_x000D_
Then there is a STR request  and the device went to STR successfully _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
14674 2024/07/12 23:27:20 087193 2031 5822 9 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [17]   LCM_LCCounter: 399 _x000D_
15154 2024/07/12 23:27:52 580360 2064 3824 238 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [3]   SHUTDOWN_SUSPEND_TO_RAM  code _x000D_
After the WAKEUP the LCCounter is set to 401 _x000D_
_x000D_
So  it is clear that there is a boot missing in-between _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
15319 2024/07/13 01:47:15 635623 0 1092 55 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [17]   LCM_LCCounter: 401 _x000D_
15374 2024/07/13 01:47:15 939953 0 2376 110 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [40]   IOC internal wake-up reason: WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER (2)  code _x000D_
  This is due to the STR budget implementation   _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
15230 2024/07/12 23:27:54 169690 2065 9730 58 IOC SMC   4097 log info non-verbose 0 [18]   Remaining STR Budget - 0 000000  code _x000D_
Since the STR budget is set to 0  Once the str current monitoring is started it found that the str budget is reached  this will cause a STR_EXIT_OFF _x000D_
_x000D_
But due to the kl30B unavailability the logger is no longer active and the log for that boot is missing _x000D_
_x000D_
Then the device woke with cold boot and sets the WUP reason as WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER _x000D_
_x000D_
This issue is already fixed with  [MGU22_24w28 2-1 https://jira cc bmwgroup net/issues/ jql=cf%5B10812%5D+%3D+MGU22_24w28 2-1] _x000D_
_x000D_
  Hence rejecting this ticket for retest with latest software _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_

The behavior is according to the following requirements _x000D_
SSD_Functional_Safety_Garmin_1373_x000D_
When the following errorbits of the SQHMI_Failure signal are detected  the module shall call the ErrorTracer that the error SAFE_MISR_CRC_ERROR occured  _x000D_
   	SQHMI_RETURN_MISR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH (8000h)_x000D_
_x000D_
SSD_Functional_Safety_Garmin_1375_x000D_
When the module function vSetError is called to set an error SAFE_MISR_CRC_ERROR the module shall set the DTC 0xB7FB8F by using the ERM interface  Furthermore  a DLT message shall be set to refer to this error  _x000D_
_x000D_

SSD_Functional_Safety_Garmin_1030_x000D_
When the following errorbits of the SQHMI_Failure signal are detected  the module shall call the EventCollector with STATUS_ERROR  This error lead to an safe state SAFS_BLANK_x000D_
   	SQHMI_RETURN_MISR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH (8000h)_x000D_
_x000D_
I do not see any SOC logs which could confirm the SQHMI_RETURN_MISR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH value received in the SQHMI_Failure on the IOC side  _x000D_
But the SQHMI Status message is E2E protected  so there is a very low chance that the message is corrupted  _x000D_
_x000D_
So the behavior is *correct from Safety point of view* _x000D_
It should be checked why the SQHMI component is sending the following value: *SQHMI_RETURN_MISR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH* in the SQHMI_Return_Failure signal_x000D_
_x000D_
From what I know  the usual root cause for this are SOC instabilities _x000D_

Assigning back to [2024-06-28 - 9:51 [  [  Update after discussion:_x000D_
_x000D_
This is a general out-of-sync problem between LCM and SAFM  that can happen in specific use-cases _x000D_
The current issue is observed in the IOC cancel shutdown use-case  when the wake-up trigger is detected while the SOC is still shutting down  In that case  the IOC will skip the BswM transitions  which will result in:_x000D_
 * No EcuM mode switch_x000D_
 * No WdgM mode switch_x000D_
 *   Mpm_OnReducedModeEntry   and   Mpm_OnReducedModeExit   callouts not called_x000D_
 ** Resulting in   vResetQMResetRequest   not being called  therefore  the reset healing counter is not cleared_x000D_
_x000D_
Next steps:_x000D_
_x000D_
[2024-07-11 - 8:45 [  [  Based on the discussion with [  The current proposal is to add an intermediate state in BswM to accommodate all the callout that shall be executed on resume  regardless in the IOC entered LPM or not _x000D_
_x000D_

The str request did not reach the IOC platform and was cancelled before the shutdown request was even made to the platform as far as i understood _x000D_
_x000D_
STR was actually considered as the recovery for safety to re enable the pins and the monitoring cycle so in that sense this behaviour is expected  But from a vehicle perspective  if the shutdown and cancel happens quickly in a cycle where safety has already kicked in once  then we could identify the point in the Lifecycle central state machines which we could consider as safety re-enabling point and do it there IMO   ;;;  [2024-07-16 - 9:10 I agree with the overall conceptual discussion and benefits we will gain by introducing a new BswM state as described by Hugo and commented by Nibil  BUT this needs proper testing and implementation is not done as of now (as final concept is not agreed  yet)  Therefore I would really like to challenge the timeline for 2411 I-510 which basically means integration into BCI within the next two weeks  [  [  Topic discussed and agreed on July 16th  Summary of the design decision follows _x000D_
_x000D_
1) A general callout will be created in the lifecycle central state machine when states are switched _x000D_
_x000D_
2) This will be created in a separate user call out file  so that any such dependencies to other modules can be handled _x000D_
_x000D_
3) Safety team shall add code to reset the counter (and whatever required) in this cancel shutdown case to re-enable safety _x000D_
_x000D_
4) Dependent PRs to be created _x000D_
_x000D_

 code _x000D_
From the logs above  we can conclude that the IOC started by reporting BOD_VDDA  due to the 3V3 rail not reaching 0V  probably due to a short time between the disconnection and reconnection of the battery  No real problem here _x000D_
_x000D_
The interesting part is that IOC also reported that the SOC was in active state right after the power cycle  even without a wake-up trigger from IOC  which means that it was already in active state when the battery power cycle was performed  Given that the WAVE UDP logs are available since around 17:20:09  we can assume that both IOC and SOC were resumed at that time  due to the wake-up trigger _x000D_
_x000D_

*Here we can see ErrorImageDataInvalid to 1 and later safety reaction triggered this might be check from IOC safety team [  [ ;tu-cc-jira-taeesi-prod;Gabriela-Mihaela Ilie:

*Timestamp:**04 04 2024  [12:24:00]* * (UTC + 1)*

I notice that after the driver engages the reverse gear in the vehicle  despite the *BCP* sending a *requestParkmenu parkmenuLayout Request* signal to open the Park menu and simultaneously requesting camera activation through the *requestPvis* signal  the Park menu is the only one that responds with a delay to the BCP   s request  It opens *42 seconds* after the reverse gear has been engaged  Simultaneously  there are significant gaps in *Service Discovery* for both the *HMI state* and the *MGU state*  Service Discovery represents communication between two Electronic Control Units (ECUs)  and if there are gaps here  the necessary signals are not transmitted-malfunction of the *MGU/IDC*  Alongside these gaps  an *Early HMI* is triggered  lasting approximately *39 seconds*  I have also extracted and verified the *AVB video streams*  which appear to be functioning correctly without any issues  The black screen is attributed to the triggering of that *Early_HMI* signal  I kindly request further investigation by the HMI team 
;;;  [  Just to clarify  are we talking about the longer startup due to STR_ERROR and   safety reaction (reset) or about the issue where RVC was suddenly closed _x000D_
Because the later one happens after android container is started and gear is put to P (unexpectedly or expectedly) which I guess will close the RVC _x000D_
_x000D_
This is neither an ICHMI issue nor safety issue _x000D_
!image-2024-04-11-12-21-56-775 png!_x000D_
However  STR_ERROR is a known issue which is currently under investigation:_x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
1134458 2024/04/04 12:22:55 666252 643 4165 66 MGUA NSM SDMG 780 log info verbose 2 mal_cb_wait_for_ponr - mayInitiatePONR is true_x000D_
1087176 2024/04/04 12:22:55 728509 643 4638 186 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [3]   SHUTDOWN_SUSPEND_TO_RAM_ETHERNET_ON_GRACEFUL_OFF_x000D_
1087600 2024/04/04 12:23:05 816285 653 5127 11 IOC LCM   4096 log info non-verbose 0 [13]   SoCMM current state: STR_ERROR_x000D_
1135592 2024/04/04 12:24:44 005956 751 6212 173 IOC SACF EvCo 4131 log error non-verbose 0 [2]   Error reported to EventCollector (Module SafifE2EGateway_SQHMIStatus)_x000D_
1135593 2024/04/04 12:24:44 005959 751 6212 174 IOC SACF ErTr 4131 log error non-verbose 0 [1]   DTC reported to RTE newly (0xB7FB78 - SAFE_STATUS_ERROR) code ;;;  [  The issue with STR_ERROR is that it leads to a mismatch between IOC and SOC  When an STR_ERROR is detected  SOC performs an unexpected cold boot instead of STR  IOC still behaves as resuming from STR _x000D_
_x000D_
That means IOC components like SafetyManager  PiaWrapper etc  do not get notified that cold boot is performed by SOC side  But this is very crucial as there are differentiations between SOC cold boot and STR from timeout perspective _x000D_
_x000D_
This is exaclty happening in this failure case  SOC performs cold boot but SafetyManager still takes the STR values for debounce time to start the supervision  As these timeouts are way shorter as the ones for cold boot  the supervision starts earlier  However  the SOC is still not available due to booting state  Thus you can see that RVC is shortly shown but then safety kicks in as SQHMIStatus supervision is active but kombi container is not even started _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
Therefore recommending taking in the robustness measure discussed here: https://jira cc bmwgroup net/browse/HU22DM-249745_x000D_
_x000D_
This will force the whole IDC to perform a cold boot in STR_ERROR case  This ensures that IOC and SOC are in sync  Of course  this might have other side effects like longer booting time ;;;  Assigning to OSIS / IOC for further discussion;;;  There is a fix for this type of situation already on mainline _x000D_
[  This issue is especially concerning in the use cases where FPN are still active and the ethernet switch is powered  as it widens the time frame for a wake-up event after an STR error before reaching the deep sleep state  which will lead to this behaviour _x000D_
The fix for mainline was integrated in IOC 38 1 0 but is not yet available in an official SW release ;;;  Pull request based on pu2407: https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6558;;;2024-04-12 - 9:06 [2024-04-12 - 9:15 [  Updating the ticket status to Resolved to present the PR https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6558 at CCB _x000D_
_x000D_

message.Combined Comments:
Hi [  OdoWrp is reporting an error:_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-03-20-13-28-41-497 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
In that case the value is expected from FuBi side  Need to be checked on supplier side why there was an error ;;;  Hi  [  Hi [  hi [  [2024-03-22 - 7:32 Hi All  I am getting an error while extracting archives _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-03-22-11-59-30-990 png width=268 height=156!_x000D_
_x000D_
Could someone kindly attach the IOC DLT logs and the MGU logs ;;;2024-03-22 - 8:19 I downloaded the files  archives are corrupted due to inconsistent network   ;;;2024-03-22 - 9:25 pls download all BRIAN_TRACES xyz files;;;  [  With the current logs  it is not possible to find the cause of the read failure  We are in discussion with our architect to find the possibilities of NvM operation failures in run time  As part of these  we are currently testing some additional DLT logging through NvM error callouts [PR#6514 https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6514]  This may help us get an idea of the cause of NvM failures in the future _x000D_
  _x000D_
From my perspective  for this issue the only option is to reproduce it with some additional DLT logs _x000D_
  _x000D_
[  [ ;johannhuckvolke-mucde;What exactly is the Question to Fubi in the appointment ;;;  Hi [  h2  Meeting notes 26 03 24 [  Issue has duplicates linked in OCTANE -> error occurrence changed from single event -> sporadic;;;  h2  Meeting notes 27 03 24 [2024-03-28 - 6:30 I discussed the configuration changes with the architect  The maximum number of retries that can be configured for individual modules is 7  and we can configure this value to be 3 or 4  depending on the block priority _x000D_
_x000D_
To configure the queue size  I am analyzing the maximum number of operations that are requested simultaneously to NvM during the runtime ;;;2024-03-28 - 9:27 h2  Meeting notes 27 03 24  [2024-04-02 - 9:25 h2  Meeting notes 02 04 24 [  [  [  [^IOC_TracesCar zip]I checked the IOC DLT traces from the car test  No NvM errors were observed ;;;  [  In the DLT logs  the PWF state switching to wohnen happened at 9   10 sec after wakeup  an NvM read was triggered from the ODO module  and the NvM failure was reported _x000D_
_x000D_
I reproduced the issue by triggering a PWF state change at 10 seconds  and the NvM read from the Odo module failed  and NvM is reporting the error NVM_E_REQ_FAILED for the Odo block _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-04-03-16-38-44-748 png width=476 height=130!_x000D_
_x000D_
*Root cause*_x000D_
_x000D_
NvM will report an NVM_E_REQ_FAILED error if the processing of the read service fails at a lower layer in the MemStack including all retries  In our case  it is the FLS module  If any FLS operations are triggered  it will set the status to MEMIF_BUSY  In this period  if the NvM manager is requested to read-write  the FLS module will reject the request _x000D_
_x000D_
A PR from the LC team recently merged to the master and sop 24/07 branches  contains changes that will write LCVitals data to the work flash  LC uses the Fls_erase and Fls_Write functions to erase and write the data 10 seconds after the wakeup  This is why NvM reported the error while reading the Odo-NvM block in the same period _x000D_
_x000D_
[https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6452]_x000D_
_x000D_
Applications that use asynchronous FLS operations during the runtime are destructive  and they can block requests from NvManager  I had a short discussion with the architect and LC team; we are planning to revert the changes from SOP24/07 and master _x000D_
_x000D_
Assigning ticket to LC for further procedure_x000D_
_x000D_

A timeout of the SQHMI message is detected according to the requirement:_x000D_
SSD_Functional_Safety_garmin_2846:_x000D_
When the SQHMI Alive Monitoring is active  the Integrity check shall detect an timeout error  if no SQHMI_Status is received for FDTI (400ms) _x000D_
_x000D_
Normally 8 SQHMI messages should be received in 400ms _x000D_
So a timeout of the SQHMI message is detected:_x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
14617 2024/02/26 12:07:24 076360 12 7850 12 IOC SAIF E2EG 4132 log warn non-verbose 0 [31]  SQHMIStatus integrity fault because of timeout    53 51 48 4d 49 53 74 61 74 75 73 20 69 6e 74 65 67 72 69 74 79 20 66 61 75 6c 74 20 62 65 63 61 75 73 65 20 6f 66 20 74 69 6d 65 6f 75 74 20 20 20_x000D_
 code _x000D_
_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Yorck Schuster color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 27 02 2024 13:18 color 

Outcome of yesterday s meeting:_x000D_
_x000D_
Error Description:_x000D_
 * IDC should go to STR sleep_x000D_
 * PWF switches to STANDFUNKTION  shutdown triggered_x000D_
 * Display is turned off  safety manager disables supervision_x000D_
 * Instead of going to STR  STR_ERROR is triggered_x000D_
 * SOC performs cold boot  IOC is never going down_x000D_
 * Safety Manager is not notified about this state and is not setting relaxed timeouts for cold boot_x000D_
 * Safety Manager will trigger E2E SQHMIStatus timeout or Coding issues_x000D_
_x000D_
Possible solution:_x000D_
_x000D_
Once LCM detects STR_ERROR  whole IDC needs to perform a reset (IOC and SOC)  This initializes the timeouts correctly and SafetyManager will not trigger a safety reaction _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_

The issue was reported from MGU_E branch which reported UDPNM crashes due to high value of lifecycleCounter read from IOA  _x000D_
_x000D_
!lc png width=1682 height=246!_x000D_
_x000D_
!udpnm-crash png width=662 height=459!_x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
lifecycleCounter value is maintained by LCM and is incremented at every proper boot - shutdown/reset/str_x000D_
_x000D_
Value is persisted in Nvm and is read back at start up _x000D_
_x000D_
Currently only possible explanation for this high value provided from IOA is that during the lc #16 a high value might be read from Nvm_x000D_
_x000D_

73737 2024/01/31 11:16:23 391497 9 2829 3 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 mrvl88q211xInitPhy(): External PHY is not initialized from firmware  esm will initialize now_x000D_
73738 2024/01/31 11:16:23 391550 9 2845 4 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 mrvl88q211xInitPhy(): External PHY is not initialized from firmware  esm will initialize now_x000D_
:_x000D_
:_x000D_
73753 2024/01/31 11:16:23 392128 9 2916 6 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 phyInitQ2112(): linkupBeforeSetMode 1_x000D_
73754 2024/01/31 11:16:23 392167 9 2916 7 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 applyOperateModeConfig(): GigPHY-default compliant mode configured!!_x000D_
73755 2024/01/31 11:16:23 392211 9 2929 8 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 phyInitQ2112(): applyOperateModeConfig() success_x000D_
73779 2024/01/31 11:16:23 393211 9 3113 9 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log info verbose 1 setupForcedSpeedDuringLinkup(): Apply init script for Q2112Ge() noformat _x000D_
But  even after initialisation of the PHY by ESM  it seems that the link is down:_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
74066 2024/01/31 11:16:23 405630 9 5533 14 MGUA ETHC ETHP 1447 log error verbose 1 phyInitQ2112(): phy init failed  link is down noformat _x000D_
After this  Gbit port never recovers and remains in the same status(down) throughout the full LC  This could happen because of wrong SMI address configured after powerup while applying invalid bootstrap configuration to the switch and upon loading mismatching Gbit PHY configurations with this wrong SMI address  the PHY link is going down  This looks like an issue with power up sequence of IOC which powers up the switch  IOC team can further check if there is any issue with the power up sequence of the switch _x000D_
_x000D_

In that boot  the power sequences executed as expected _x000D_
_x000D_
Switch will powered in FULL_RUN_PT1 and FULL_RUN_PT2 _x000D_

if the switch is not working  then the there will be a SHUTDOWN_ERROR_RESET or HARD_ERROR_RESET _x000D_

But in this case there are no such resets seen in the logs _x000D_
_x000D_

Since this is a KSP car  crashes/BOD s are expected and it can be rejected based on the document [https://asc bmw com/wiki/pages/viewpage action focusedCommentId=804080783 pageId=801541980]_x000D_
_x000D_
[  2024-03-12 GW: root cause: BOD is detected ( which leads to bootstrap problems during switch configuration )  BOD which is an often seen   ( BOD ) behaviour   in KSP cars  Therefore this ticket will be rejected  The car should be checked for voltage stability ( battery  connectors    ) instead of ethernet quality measurements  _x000D_

Tobias Ellwanger:

Hello 

a short description for a better analyse:

The car was sleeping over night  after it was been driven from another driver and get to the loading station to be loaded 

I have opened it up by pressing the key knob and got into it 

Usually the CID start up at the moment the car opens up 

As i were in the car  the CID was all black 

The CID did nothing at all  but all the other functions such as putting the ignition on or even drive the car were full on and usable 

I drove to the workshop (about 100m) and checked if i could restart it via the on/off button with a longpress  After nothing happend  i got out of the car to let it deep sleep 

The bus rest did not help at all  so i decided to make a CheckIN and then a reset with TOOL32 

That helped to make the CID work again 

When it was back to life  i put in a new MGU SW  color  color:#000000 HU__MGU_02_A__PROD_24W06_4_1 003_013_002 pdx color  color:#000000    Since then  there where no black CID 

Best  Regards

* color:#4c9aff Vishnu Udayan color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 12 02 2024 13:24 color  color:#505f79  - edited by  color  color:#4c9aff Vishnu Udayan color  color:#505f79  - 13 02 2024 07:50 color 

 color:#4c9aff Greeshma Santhosh color _x000D_
_x000D_
1  NvM functionality_x000D_
_x000D_
The LCM is not immediately reading the FetraFla mode value from the NVM  LCM makes use of the RAM variable instead  This variable will be updated after the NvM ReadAll  From the attached DLT logs  NvM ReadAll was completed   _x000D_
_x000D_
In LCM   LCM_GetFeTraFlaErrorStatus  function is used to check errors related to the NvM block  The GetErrorStatus function will return block-dependent error or status information  This function will return NOK if the initialization has some errors   Since it is not a direct read  the a successful NvM ReadAll is enough to get the last stored value in the NvM block _x000D_
   _x000D_
 2  Port connection between INC and LCM_x000D_
   _x000D_
 The port connection is already there to send the data from IncLcaAdapt to LCM  At the code level  the flow goes like this:_x000D_
   _x000D_
 *Write : Rte_Write_pp_RequestFeTraFlaMode_FeTraFlaModeRequestValue* (IncLacAdapt) -> *Rte_Write_IncLcaAdpt_pp_RequestFeTraFlaMode_FeTraFlaModeRequestValue* (Rte c) ->  _x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
*Read : LCM_Read_FeTraFlaMode*  ->  *Rte_Read_rp_RequestFeTraFlaMode_FeTraFlaModeRequestValue*(LCM) ->  *Rte_Read_LCM_rp_RequestFeTraFlaMode_FeTraFlaModeRequestValue* (Rte c)  _x000D_
   _x000D_
 Each write and read RTE call has a status of EOK or E_NOT_OK to indicate that the function call is successful or not  and the status needs to be verified on the application side _x000D_
   _x000D_
 Fyi_x000D_
_x000D_

 quote 2  Check if INC is working properly from the traces   _x000D_
 quote _x000D_
The request from SoC through INC lands in the function *updateEnergySavingMode()* where INC update the value from SoC to the RTE buffer _x000D_
_x000D_
It always returns TRUE  So  it s difficult to confirm whether the write to RTE is successful or not _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-02-23-12-37-16-817 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
  To verify this  we can return the RTE status instead of always returning TRUE _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2024-02-23-12-37-48-099 png!_x000D_

Analysis from Stability frontdesk _x000D_
Here initially  SHUTDOWN_SAFETY_VIOLATION_BLANK_RESET was triggered but not completed and LCM was requesting to SHUTDOWN_SAFETY_VIOLATION_BLANK_RESET but never triggered and later invalid wakeup reason got received as WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER _x000D_
_x000D_
Later WAKEUP_REASON_IOC_WATCHDOG_RESET triggered after the coldboot _x000D_
_x000D_
Also  SHUTDOWN_MCU_BOD_VDDA_RESET_RESTART was the recovered Shutdownrsh with wakeupReason as WAKEUP_REASON_IOC_WATCHDOG_RESET_x000D_
_x000D_
Moving to OSIS->IOC to have further look on this issue _x000D_

As per the issue description PWF state was PAD _x000D_
_x000D_
The  SHUTDOWN_SAFETY_VIOLATION_BLANK_RESET reset wont be executed from LCM side if the PWF state is PRUEFEN_ANALYSE_DIAGNOSE based on requirements _x000D_
_x000D_
The BOD reset observed in the system may due to the sudden voltage drop in the system  but we lack logs to confirm this _x000D_
_x000D_
Further analysis required from safety team  why disabled display reset pins _x000D_

From the IOC serial logs _x000D_
_x000D_
Around the error time stamp  13:12 (UTC+1) 28/11/2023 _x000D_
_x000D_
The system went to STR and woke with Ethernet WUP _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-12-07-12-24-48-023 png width=962 height=367!_x000D_
_x000D_
PMD accepted the power sequence FULL RUN 1 but it is failed to complete the power sequence _x000D_
_x000D_
This is because one of the pin from the list is not enabled so the power sequence got stuck _x000D_
_x000D_
Since the NET_PWR_EN pin is not enabled    PGOOD pins are not high _x000D_
_x000D_
This behavior is same as  HU22DM-217976_x000D_
_x000D_
Duplicate to  HU22DM-217976 _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
WUP KL30B HIGH was observed due to the voltage drop below and rising back to the running voltage  which leads to  WAKEUP_REASON_SWITCH_TO_POWER _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-12-07-12-33-37-476 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
This is the expected behavior from IOC LC POV _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
hence closing this ticket as duplicate to  HU22DM-217976 _x000D_

Here issue is with the power sequence that is performed even before initializing cid/apix application  This is part of the general power sequence for the peripherals which life cycle execute on every startup  Only after completing this sequence the lifecycle will provide us the enable request to start the application _x000D_
_x000D_
-> Here the BMW logo might be expected as the cid is powered externally from the clamp30 but without the apix link (lifecycle never provides us the enable request) _x000D_
_x000D_
What I understand form  color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color  s  last comment  as part of the initial sequence  they tried to run the CID power sequences (as part of general power sequence) which is not getting completed  as they are not getting the expected high signal from the Status_PIN0 _x000D_

After release of hardware reset  the INAP indicates the successful lock of the internal PLL by_x000D_
 raising pin STATUS0 to high  Afterwards the chip starts the calibration of the APIX physical layer  On completion  the chip drops pin STATUS1 to low _x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Hugo Cunha color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 29 11 2023 19:37 color  color:#505f79  - edited by  color  color:#4c9aff Hugo Cunha color  color:#505f79  - 29 11 2023 19:51 color

 color:#4c9aff Ajeesh Sahadevan color   based on graph and table that you shared  we can conclude the the PLL didn t lock and therefore  the CID_STATUS0 didn t go up  We should try to understand why _x000D_
_x000D_
One thing that I can think of as a reason for the CID_STATUS0 pin to remain low  is the CID_RESET_3V3 handling  To clarify  the CID_RESET_3V3 pin logic meaning is:_x000D_
 * LOW: INAP in reset_x000D_
 * HIGH: INAP out of reset_x000D_
_x000D_
!cid-inap-reset-line png width=801 height=321!_x000D_
_x000D_
I ve just checked the MGU E-branch code and the  CID_RESET_3V3 (named  CID_RESET_IOC in Port xdm) is configured as output HIGH in  *all* the port configurations  It means that it s *not* guaranteed that the INAP chip is held in RESET state during power mode transitions  i e   during STR resume when the VDD_IOC_RUN_3V3 and VDD_1 2V power rails are enabled again _x000D_
_x000D_
!cid-inap-power png width=803 height=105!_x000D_
_x000D_
Enabling the INAP chip power supply without holding it in reset state could cause internal clock stability issues and affect the internal PLL locking _x000D_
_x000D_
As said in my previous comments  we had issues in the past with the port configuration of IDC23  and I would expect similar problems in MGU22  Please review these configurations to evaluate the need for porting them back to MGU22 _x000D_
_x000D_
Regarding the robustness/recovery measure (a k a  workaround) of implementing a timeout/watchdog in the power sequence execution  it is needed because we should ultimately avoid a completely unresponsive ECU scenario  but it should always be the last resort as it will impact the user experience (reset  cold boot  displays black for a longer period than the expected) ;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-217976 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-217976 focusedCommentId=4369618 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-4369618]  color

_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 01 11 2023 13:43 color 

From further analysis the CAN_INH interrupt gets missed during the Mcu_InitClock call during the STR entry  _x000D_
 Preventing the ETH wake source to the ECUM the timing changes and as a result the INH would hit earlier  So the issue will not get reproduced_x000D_
 !DS0279 PNG! _x000D_
 The the Yellow line is the CAN_INH line and the purple line shows the DEBUG led   The First rise of the DEBUG LED is during the Mcu_InitClock and during this time the CAN_INH low to high Interrupt is missed _x000D_

Checked the DLT logs and it does look like ESM is in good state and processing clients  requests till 12:49:04:_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
89940 2023/10/15 12:49:03 631000 318 5318 3 MGUA ETHC ETHC 1333 log info verbose 1 writeDataToClient(): Sent the data of:32 to client 12  status 0_x000D_
89941 2023/10/15 12:49:03 631000 318 5318 4 MGUA ETHC ETHC 1333 log info verbose 1 handleDiagSrvcReq(): EthSwitchMgr - Diagnostic command[9] completed  time taken:0 00131 sec (Apr 27 2023)_x000D_
90005 2023/10/15 12:49:04 556000 319 5018 5 MGUA ETHC ETHC 1333 log info verbose 1 clientReqHandler(): read bytes:12032 from client fd 12_x000D_
90006 2023/10/15 12:49:04 556000 319 5018 6 MGUA ETHC ETHC 1333 log info verbose 1 handleDiagSrvcReq(): Processing client req command 10 noformat _x000D_
But suddenly after this timestamp  we can notice that ESM is not getting any responses from the switch for the RMU requests it is trying to send and hence it is reporting RMU time-outs:_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
90034 2023/10/15 12:49:05 181000 320 0987 110 MGUA ETHC ETHM 1333 log error verbose 1 ethSendRMUReq: RMU Time-out  retry = 2_x000D_
90096 2023/10/15 12:49:06 245000 321 0988 111 MGUA ETHC ETHM 1333 log error verbose 1 ethSendRMUReq: RMU Time-out  retry = 1_x000D_
90162 2023/10/15 12:49:07 166000 322 0989 112 MGUA ETHC ETHM 1333 log error verbose 1 ethSendRMUReq: RMU Time-out  Probe with new SMI addr_x000D_
90163 2023/10/15 12:49:07 166000 322 0990 113 MGUA ETHC ETHM 1333 log error verbose 1 ethSendRMUReq: current SMI addr 0_x000D_
90164 2023/10/15 12:49:07 166000 322 0990 114 MGUA ETHC ETHM 1333 log error verbose 1 ethSendRMUReq: probing with new SMI addr 1 noformat _x000D_
After RMU time-out  ESM keeps probing with all possible SMI addresses(0-15) to check if switch SMI address is changed but even then there is no response from the switch  After trying for some time  ethctrlmgr exits:_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
134890 2023/10/15 12:52:28 545000 24 8204 237 MGUA MON THRD 1460 log info verbose 1 TID:1343 ethctrlmgr exited parent:1320  ethctrlmgr  Thread count:765 noformat _x000D_
  And this is the reason why the clients(including ethdiag) connected to ethctrlmgr fails to get any response from it:_x000D_
 noformat _x000D_
104422 2023/10/15 12:50:52 718000 427 6339 21 MGUA SYS JOUR 1557 log error verbose 4 2023/10/14 16:27:49 370207 427 371280 mgu22 ffptool[2131]: ethctrlswdlclient: ethCtrlSwdlGetData(): client select timeout after 80 secs_x000D_
104423 2023/10/15 12:50:52 718000 427 6340 22 MGUA SYS JOUR 1557 log error verbose 4 2023/10/14 16:27:49 370235 427 372354 mgu22 ffptool[2131]: ethctrlswdlclient: ethCtrlSwdlSrvcReq():read failed  Ret:2_x000D_
135103 2023/10/15 12:52:28 549000 24 9456 1 MGUA ETHD DIAG 1801 log error verbose 1 ethCtrlInitDiagSrvc():connection to ethctrl srvr failed noformat _x000D_
So  with the above logs  I think there is no issue with ESM but there could be an issue with switch side which is not being powered appropriately  Maybe IOC team can check if something is going wrong in the switch powerup sequence  Please note that this is not happening only once  We can see that switch recovered after sometime and starts responding to RMU requests from ESM and again goes off after some time ;;;2023-11-05 - 2:03;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-207335 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-207335 focusedCommentId=4233739 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-4233739]  color

cc  color:#4c9aff Unnikrishnan B color   color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color   color:#4c9aff Nandu Sasidharan color ;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-194555 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-194555 focusedCommentId=4073007 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-4073007]  color

* color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 05 09 2023 16:37 color  color:#505f79  - edited by  color  color:#4c9aff Unnikrishnan B color  color:#505f79  - 05 09 2023 16:42 color 

From   further analysis and debugging the reset has occurred because during boot up   pulsing of pin  PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR  is timed out _x000D_
_x000D_
For every power sequence the expected timeout is 2500 iterations  In the issue scenario when power sequence    _x000D_
 MGU_IDC_GeneralSoCPowerUp  is executed   pin  PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR is pulsed ie it is set to high for the first 50ms and then set to low  During the time when PMD waits   for   PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR  to be   high for 50 ms there is a timeout observed  During this time the Power sequence  hits timeout and the aliveness ping from IOC lifecycle is stopped as recovery hence the WDG ERR _x000D_
 The issue seems to be an issue with performance as this timeout is only observed in perf builds _x000D_
 The time read from system time (for the 50ms wait period )seems to be wrong(needs to be confirmed by the Health Team)_x000D_
 Next Steps:_x000D_
 Health Team needs to analyze this issue as this occurred in the perf builds and also whether there is an issue with the System Time read   _x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#4c9aff Paul Hitha color  Please move this to AOX performance team for further debugging_x000D_

Based on this  I d venture to guess the USB cable on this setup is going bad and needs to be replaced    It looks like the USB connection is flaky    Looks like the unit started dev flashing  flash failed due to a USB connection issue  and then dmverity no longer allowed the unit to boot because the partially-flashed update caused the hashes to not match anymore _x000D_

cc  color:#4c9aff Unnikrishnan B color   color:#4c9aff Vinod George color   color:#4c9aff Paul Hitha color ;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-194555 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-194555 focusedCommentId=4083181 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-4083181]  color

* color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 07 09 2023 16:22 color  color:#505f79  - edited by  color  color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color  color:#505f79  - 08 09 2023 05:56 color 

From further analyzing and debugging it is found that during the startup before the OS starts  scheduling LCM request power sequences and polls  until the power sequence is completed  The polling happens in a while  loop  So when the power sequence is requested continuously from  the loop the value which is used to calculate the power sequence timeout exceeds before  the 50ms pulse of PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR is completed  _x000D_
The time period taken for the variable to reach 2500 count   is 49941us  ie for one iteration of the loop it takes 19 97 uS  So when when PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR  is pulsed ie (when the gpio is set to high and waits for 50ms to set it to low) before the gpio stays high for 50ms the timeout is hit  _x000D_
When checking on other builds  builds the time taken for the variable to reach 2500 count is 50390 uS ie each iteration tool approx  20 830 uS  As a result in other builds the pin got successfully pulsed before the timeout  _x000D_
 !MicrosoftTeams-image (10) png! _x000D_
In the attached image the Counter2 val shows the count taken for pulsing the PMD_MAIN_SOC_CBL_PWR  initial and final time is time taken for exiting from the while in a nomal build  _x000D_
_x000D_
A fix pr will be created into mainline  without increased timeout periods _x000D_
The PR will be finalized after discussion with  color:#4c9aff Nibil PM color  _x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 04 09 2023 13:14 color 

From analyzing the logs while the IOC was going to full off due to a STR_ERR there was a CAN INH interrupt hit which is treated as a validated wake up from ECUM _x000D_
 So when IOC is in  EcuM_AL_Reset  state IOC has a validated wakeup (EcuMConf_EcuMWakeupSource_ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN_INH_IK) but is not validated in  EcuM_AL_Reset  state and as a result system goes through a  LCM_SHUTDOWN_UNINTENDED_START_WO_REASON   reset _x000D_
 During the full off transition in the CAN logs valid B4 messages are found _x000D_
 !MicrosoftTeams-image (8) png!_x000D_

Hi  just so that we are having the same understanding:_x000D_
_x000D_
For PU2311 the content  [#6157 https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6157]  is already prepared and part of a potential IOC  This is the actual fix of the symptom and avoids that in case of  SHUTDOWN_UNINTENDED_START_WO_REASON the eth-switch is not reset  The proper fix to solve the actual root cause is the change in  [#6167 https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/6167]  that validates  PMD_ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN_INH_IK in addition to  PMD_ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN0 which ultimately will avoid reaching the unintended start wo reason  Is this understanding correct   _x000D_
If so I agree that the fix #6157 is sufficient for the PU2311 hence it is already part of the prepared build  However  adding the second parameter for validation of the wake source is not too risky isn t it  For me this looks more like a complete fix instead of healing the symptom   _x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Mayavathi K R color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 24 08 2023 07:32 color 

Hello  color:#4c9aff Lakshmi Ajikumar color  _x000D_
_x000D_
On analyzing the logs  after shutdown fulloff  KL30 was turned on after a delay which caused the cold boot with reason KL30_FIRST_APPLIED_x000D_
_x000D_
As per the test case that you have followed  VALID_SWITCH_TO_POWER will be printed only in case of warm boot where the KL30 is turned on after shutdown full off without delay _x000D_
_x000D_
This is because  when we switch off the power supply quickly  KL30 may not be discharging completely   so we end up with a warm boot (VALID_SWITCH_TO_POWER)  When there is a timeslot to power on the target of around 20

The RxD interrupt will be removed from the source code  _x000D_

The issue for the cold boots is that since 30B is higher during STR the IOC consumes power from the 30B clamp _x000D_
_x000D_
Based on inputs from Hardware team    _x000D_
_x000D_
It is also not required to consume current from KL30F while KL30B is still present (the system simply needs to be +prepared+ to consume power from KL30F such that the unit is not reset once KL30B is removed_x000D_
_x000D_
KL30B and KL30F are tied to the same upstream power source (so it shouldn t be possible for them to be at different voltages  other than due to IR losses in the harnesses)    Since KL30B is a much higher power consumer than KL30F  it is more likely that KL30B would actually be lower than KL30F typically _x000D_
_x000D_
Conclusions_x000D_
 # This issue cannot occur in a car because the voltage difference of 30B and 30F  points could be greater than the test setup _x000D_
_x000D_
So as next steps please retest keeping the difference between 30b and 30f   >1 volt(30f should be greater than 30b )  This would create a scenario that is similar to that of the car   _x000D_
_x000D_

what is this test case about  the HU is in an undervoltage scenario and resetting/restarting  --> even if a RSU use case was running when the undervoltag scenario occurs the RSU use-case is getting restarted from the last persisted sync point to get finalized  --> RSU use-case is continued in PAD mode   _x000D_
If the display is not resetted/restarted the customer will experience a  black  screen until the next deep reset     _x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
I don t think it is expected behavior (even not for RSU) that the display is not getting restarted in case of undervoltage/broken APIX link  I think the current implementation of the display restart (due to undervoltage) collides with the RSU requirement  that there is no  SHUTDOWN_SAFETY_VIOLATION_BLANK_RESET in the normal RSU use case and it needs to be investigated how the display restart could be implemented in the undervoltage scenario      ;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-178545 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-178545 focusedCommentId=4088792 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-4088792]  color

* color:#4c9aff Gayathri Vinayan color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 11 09 2023 07:41 color 

Hi  color:#4c9aff Thomas Hack color  _x000D_
_x000D_
From the display  POV   the under-voltage is causing the apix link to unstable for more than 400ms   which results safety reaction  then this is an expected behavior   and it will only recover after a safety reset (also depends on PWF state) or manual cold boot _x000D_
_x000D_
Also  if the display exits the under-voltage  condition and Apix link re-establishes within 400 ms(safety timeout)  display will recover back to the ON state  But here  in this test case  since the apix link is unstable for more than the safety timeout due to under-voltage condition  Safety has been triggered to turn OFF the displays and requested for ECU reset  which is expected   _x000D_
_x000D_
Due to the PWF state (which is PAD in this case)  the safety reset request is never acknowledged _x000D_
->If it is expected to enable the safety ecu reset in pad state also   then this  should  be handled from either safety/LCM _x000D_
_x000D_
To the clarification for the above-mentioned  comment  it is the Safety not the display that is triggering the restart   So  there is no question for collision _x000D_
_x000D_

From IOC LC POV based on the requirement IF PWF state is *PAD* *PARKEN_BN_NIO* or  *KEINE_KOMMUNIKATION*    the Safety reset request will be refused _x000D_
_x000D_
If the voltage level reaches below the threshold (5 5v) from LC side a    SHUTDOWN_UNDERVOLTAGE will be performed   _x000D_
_x000D_
This is an expected behavior hence rejecting the ticket _x000D_
_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 28 07 2023 14:43 color 

From analyzing the IOC serial logs  there was shutdown request to IOC at 04:18:02 and IOC has processed this request successfully _x000D_
After  1 3 minutes IOC wakes with wake up reason Switch To Power  The MCU reset reason is  RESET_REASON_POWER_ON  _x000D_
For IOC to switch from sleep to Off there should be a dip in 30f voltage  Since IOC is in sleep no logs will be available during this time  _x000D_
From analysis this issue seems to be a issue with the 30f clamp and IOC exited from sleep to full off and also from the MCU reset reason we can infer that there has been a Full Off happening in IOC side _x000D_
Since this is happening in multiple cycles this seems to be an issue with the KL30F line   color:#4c9aff Madhura Deshmukh color  could you please confirm the KL30F line is connected and if there is any issue with the clamp connection _x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Hugo Cunha color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 18 07 2023 01:40 color  color:#505f79  - edited by  color  color:#4c9aff Hugo Cunha color  color:#505f79  - 18 07 2023 01:43 color 

Based on the log analysis  the issue occurred during a cancel shutdown scenario  The BswM prepare shutdown sequence was not completed and the LCM kept stuck in the CHECK_RESTART state  Although the wake-up signals were detected (wake-up line and CAN)  the LCM relies on the proper BswM prepare shutdown sequence to react to a wake-up trigger to avoid the preemption against Fubi sleep/wake-up _x000D_
_x000D_
We ve analyzed the BswM sequence and prepared a flowchart to allow a more detailed analysis of the shutdown and cancel shutdown cases  and understand in which step it got stuck  preventing the sync with LCM to proceed with the wake-up _x000D_
_x000D_
!BswM drawio png width=950 height=2529!_x000D_
_x000D_
According to the logs  the action *A_RTC_STRProcess* in *BswM_PrepShutdown* was not executed (no DLT)  therefore  we are assuming (for now) that it could be stuck in the previous state _x000D_
_x000D_
*Next actions:*_x000D_
 * *Continue the code analysis*_x000D_
 * *Attempt to repro the issue using CAN interface (described in the next comment)*_x000D_
 ** *Configure Vector to send 0xB4 wake-up message on trigger*_x000D_
 ** *Prepare build to set the trigger signal*_x000D_
 * *Attempt repro in rack with automated EDIABAS script (cancel shutdown scenario)*;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-175811 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-175811 focusedCommentId=3891956 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3891956]  color

In w r t  the reproduction of the issue  the testing focus should be on the cancel shutdown scenario  where the wake-up should be triggered right after the prepare shutdown request (to BswM) _x000D_
 This is particularly difficult to achieve given that we don t have any specific signal to be used as a trigger for the wake-up in the right moment _x000D_

 code _x000D_
One possibility is to use a Vector CAN interface to send the wake-up message to the ECU using a signal from IDC as an external trigger  as described below  using a Vector VN5610A as a reference _x000D_
_x000D_
1) Vector VN5610A USB side connectors:_x000D_
 !VN5610A-1 png width=521 height=196!_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-13-41-880 png width=504 height=189!_x000D_
_x000D_
2) Open a CAN simulation  disable all the ETH and CAN nodes and add a CAN IG (Interactive Generator) _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-46-10-602 png width=469 height=358!_x000D_
_x000D_
3) Configure the Vector I/O:_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-15-55-235 png width=421 height=90!_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-16-21-387 png width=486 height=109!_x000D_
_x000D_
4) Add a new message in a CAN Interactive Generator  using the digital input as a trigger:_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-21-59-687 png width=714 height=428!_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-18-00-22-25-138 png width=712 height=178!_x000D_
_x000D_
5) According to the Vector VN5610A documentation  the L->H level for the trigger input is 3 4V  so it s not guaranteed that the IOC debug pin (IOC_DEBUG_LED) can be used directly as a trigger  So _x000D_
_x000D_
a) we can use the  IOC_DEBUG_LED to trigger some sort of solid state relay (3 3V to 12V)_x000D_
_x000D_
b) we can use the IDC ETH wake-up line output (12V) by connecting it to the Vector DIO_x000D_
_x000D_
6) To attempt the repro  the trigger (IOC_DEBUG_LED (a) or ETH_WAKE_OUT (b)) shall be set right after the prepare shutdown request _x000D_

hi  color:#4c9aff Matthias Behr color   color:#4c9aff Robert Reiter color _x000D_
_x000D_
Without the Ecum_SetWakeupEvent call  Ecum_ValidateWakeupevent won t work because eth_wup need to be in pending stage for validation  So as per current implementation  *Eth Wup is not getting validated by Ecum* and only getting validated from PMD_vChecksources which is called as part of 2ms cyclic task  So there is chance that we may miss eth wup of very short duration   _x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
This issue was found from an ZST test case when the MGU missed an eth Pulse of 21ms duration _x000D_
_x000D_

 color:#4c9aff Kyle Sabell color    color:#4c9aff Matthias Behr color  _x000D_
_x000D_
Based on the scope screen shot and the current code in the PR  I think that at first  both IOC and INAP are actively driving the HUD_MB0_3 3V line  In the PMD_HUD_OutputsDisable sequence  the HUD_RESET_3 3V is now the first line to be set low  and this causes the INAP to immediately stop driving the MB0 line  and therefore  the voltage starts to rise because IOC is still driving the HUD_MB0_3 3V line high  Then  in the end of the sequence  we reconfigure the HUD_MB0_3 3V as an input in IOC  and it drops to 0V _x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#4c9aff Kyle Sabell color   can you please provide a screen shot of the scope in the same scenario  including also HUD_RESET_3 3V and  HUD_PWR_EN_IOC_3 3V lines _x000D_

Anyhow  as discussed this morning with  color:#4c9aff Bhavin Savaj color  and  color:#4c9aff Peter Schreitl color   this 1 5V working level doesn t seem to be expected  The assumption is that at some point  both IOC and INAP could be driving the MB0 line  If this is true  then there would be a current of 100mA flowing through MB0 line (R7019 is 33R)  That is much higher than the typical current rating of the GPIOs (10mA)  and on limit cases  it could lead to premature degradation of the HW  We should follow up on this topic (not for 23/7) ;;; ;tu-for-sync-iukpmt;(i)  color:#505f79 This comment has been migrated from issue [HU22DM-173227 https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-173227 focusedCommentId=3874825 page=com atlassian jira plugin system issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3874825]  color

Hii  color:#4c9aff Matthias Baumann color _x000D_
_x000D_
     There could 2 potential causes  _x000D_
 # Since we have the logs available indicating the MPM reduced entry  one potential cause could be after LPM  wakeup was missed - PR    [https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/5829]   was raised for this   _x000D_
_x000D_
Ethernet Wake up is only validated if IOC has a valid KL30B voltage  Kl30B interrupt is only hit if the there is rising edge in the KL30B line which occurs only if the KL30b goes below an absolute min val  Here the KL30B rise is always monitored during LPM to check if   there was a dip in the KL30B line and all rises from this dip is considered as a wake up for MGU _x000D_
_x000D_
Also  the timing variables which was used to calculate the ISR timing was shared between normal mode  and ISR s so the chances for wake up validation could fail  This was also rectified _x000D_
_x000D_
2  Regarding the 3 days not waking up scenario the MPM_reduced_entry could have failed and IOC failed to go to sleep and keeps looping in CHECK-RESTART _x000D_
_x000D_
PR     -[https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/5681/files]-    _x000D_
_x000D_
Here we never requested a reduced mode before entering in to the LCM_CR_WUP_INVALID case  i e  LCM_CR_WUP_INVALID is now the default case for requesting a reduced mode and also the case where the system entering to the LPM and then waking up due to an invalid wakeup (which should never occur now as all the wakeups are validated before exiting LPM) _x000D_
_x000D_
BswM_RequestMode(WUP_EXPIRED_ID  (BswM_ModeType)TRUE) was earlier used only to handle invalid wakeup triggering exit from LPM _x000D_
_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Greeshma Santhosh color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 05 07 2023 15:31 color 

IOC LC Analysis:_x000D_
_x000D_
In IOC serial traces *WDG ERR is observed* and  SHUTDOWN_IOC_WDGM_RESET is performed as a recovery reset of this WDG ERROR _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-05-18-31-36-270 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
In this case WDG ERR is occurred because of WdgCounter Expired and Watchdog LCM_STATUS got ALIVE_FAILED _x000D_
_x000D_
Here System stays in CHECK_RESTART state for 42 seconds which cause the  WdgCounter Expired _x000D_
_x000D_
This is introduced as a Fail safe mechanism in which system never gets stuck in CHECK_RESTART state  Ideally System has to go to either sleep/fulloff   or wakes up in 42 seconds _x000D_
_x000D_
But here  System neither goes to sleep/fulloff or wakesup during these 42 seconds   _x000D_
_x000D_
*A   WAKEUP event is detected within 42 seconds  but the system didn t wakeup *_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-05-18-48-52-196 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
*1  WDG ERR is expected as system stays in CHECK_RESTART state for 42 seconds *_x000D_
_x000D_
*2  Why  system didn t wakeup even after detecting the*    *WAKEUP event within 42seconds*  *- _Analysis is ongoing_*_x000D_
_x000D_

_IOC LC Analysis:__x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#00875a *Good case:  color:#505f79 When the system is in CHECK_RESTART LC state  the value of color    color:#0747a6 [BswM OnRun]Processed   is 0 color   color:#505f79 (which means system is currently not running it s preparing for shutdown) and color   color:#0747a6 [BswM PrepShutdown]Processed color   color:#505f79 value must be color   color:#0747a6 1 color  * color _x000D_
_x000D_
* color:#de350b But Here in this case   the system is in CHECK_RESTART LC state the color *  color:#0747a6 *value of both   [BswM OnRun]Processed and  [BswM PrepShutdown]Processed is 0*    color _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-07-06-18-34-11-269 png!_x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#172b4d *Because here when the system prepares to go to shutdown at the same moment an ETHWUP is detected and accepted  So both the  color:#0747a6 VALUES ARE SET TO ZERO color  *  color _x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#172b4d *As both the values are Zero system never process the functionalities of OnRun or PrepShutdown * color _x000D_
_x000D_
 color:#172b4d ****That s why system neither goes shutdown and   nor wakes up and system stays in CHECK_RESTART state for 42 secs * color _x000D_
_x000D_

To conclude:_x000D_
_x000D_
Issue:_x000D_
 * This is a sporadic corner case in the check restart scenario:_x000D_
 ** Processing shutdown to Sleep > Check restart valid sources > no valid wakeup > goes to the case for invalid wakeup > a wakeup interrupt comes in (the one that is missed here) > but due to this corner case it is not processed as the system as per logic is already running (onRun) _x000D_
 * LCM is recovering this case with the 42 second recovery shutdown as expected _x000D_
_x000D_
Next steps:_x000D_
 * This particular corner case can be addressed with a design change but too risky for 2307 or 2311(due to very less testing window)_x000D_
 * The issue is reported as single event and is not easily reproducible _x000D_
 * Fix can be provided to mainline and validated properly for 24/07  _x000D_
_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Akhila Gopakumar color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 23 06 2023 14:16 color 

+*IOC-LC-Analysis:*+_x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
_x000D_
From the attached IOC  [^uv_issue_ioc2 dlt]_x000D_
_x000D_
Issue is observed when the KL30B voltage goes below undervoltage threshold(6v) with ethernet pulse given _x000D_
_x000D_
As per the current logic  ethernet wakeup was already set in the global Variable *LCM__u32PrevCheckRestartWkEvents* before triggering SHUTDOWN_UNDERVOLTAGE _x000D_
_x000D_
While processing UNDERVOLTAGE_SHUTDOWN  LC state changes to CHECK_RESTART and LCM detects wakeup from *LCM__u32PrevCheckRestartWkEvents  *_x000D_
_x000D_
The LC state changes to WAKEUP_REQUEST but the LCM didn t get   wakeUpSources_flag since it is cleared  and hence loops in the state for getting a valid wakeup reason _x000D_
_x000D_
Then SHUTDOWN_UNDERVOLTAGE comes again and LC state changes to SHUTTING_DOWN and to CHECK_RESTART _x000D_
_x000D_
Since *LCM__u32PrevCheckRestartWkEvents* is cleared on *LCM_READY * LCM detects wakeup from *LCM__u32PrevCheckRestartWkEvents*  again and the cycle continues _x000D_
_x000D_

_x000D_
Further analysis is in progress _x000D_

 code _x000D_
I was able to reproduce parts of this strange behavior in the rack but unfortunately  my BCP is not updated and sends the incorrect CAN wake-up pattern (bit 4 instead of bit 16)  so I had to manually send it to the bus _x000D_
_x000D_
By executing the following steps:_x000D_
 * setting the PWF to PARKEN_x000D_
 * wait for COMM to change to NO_COMM_x000D_
 * setting PWF to WOHNEN before the STR_x000D_
_x000D_
The first observation in my tests is that the COMM doesn t change to FULL_COMM again even if the PNs are still transmitted  the CAN selective wake-up pattern (in 0xB4 message) is needed _x000D_
 The other observation is that the CAN INH pin is always high (transceiver is active)  but COMM is NO_COMM and there s CAN traffic on the bus _x000D_
 By sending the 0xB4 message the COMM changes to FULL_COMM again but I ve noticed that sometimes it s not on the first (or second) attempt  This might be because I m sending it mannually (and not continuously by the BCP)  but there s another possibility:_x000D_
 Whenever COMM is NO_COMM and the CAN selective wake-up pattern is received  CanIf sets the ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN0 event and LCM requests NO_COMM on every ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN0 event (while in Ready state)  I suspect that this creates some kind of race condition in the internal COMM state machine transitions _x000D_
_x000D_
I ve done some tests with a debug code that requests COMM_SILENT_COMMUNICATION on every ECUM_WKSOURCE_CAN0 (which makes more sense from the logic standpoint) and I didn t observed the failed NO_COMM to FULL_COMM transition attempts again  Additional debug and tests are needed _x000D_
_x000D_

_IOC LC Analysis:__x000D_
_x000D_
From the traces WATCHDOG_RESET is triggered due to MCU_BOD_VDDA_x000D_
_x000D_
The car had emergency reset switch during the defect timestamp   _x000D_
_x000D_
While analyzing the logs it s observed that two power on resets happened consecutively with second s delay  Hence it seems like the driver might have triggered the emergency switch _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-06-02-16-45-35-233 png width=655 height=290!_x000D_

*First power on reset is happened with in one second of an ongoing lifecycle *_x000D_
_x000D_

_x000D_
*After 18 seconds Power on reset is triggered again *_x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-06-02-16-45-24-676 png width=713 height=272!_x000D_
_x000D_
*Emergency switch reset might be the reason for the BOD *_x000D_
_x000D_

* color:#4c9aff Jerlin Jose color * color:#505f79  added a comment - 02 06 2023 06:59 color 

Previously the 16th bit of the B4 message was considered as WUP bit  but  with this PR  [https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/5414] the WUP bit is changed to the 4th bit of the B4 message _x000D_
_x000D_
Basically  BCP is the one that sends B4 messages to ECU _x000D_
_x000D_
Here the issue is the BCP sent the old WUP bit (16th bit of B4) which is not valid anymore   _x000D_
_x000D_
So BCP needs to be updated   _x000D_
_x000D_
*Please update the BCP* and perform the retest with  [BMWIDC23;pu2307-23w19 3-1-nodex_IDC23_D_23w19 3-1-8;idc23 https://asc bmw com/mgujira/issues/ jql=cf%5B14401%5D+%3D+%22BMWIDC23%3Bpu2307-23w19 3-1-nodex_IDC23_D_23w19 3-1-8%3Bidc23%22]_x000D_

+*IOC-LC-Analysis:*+_x000D_
_x000D_
Here in the attached IOC log   [^2023-05-22_12-40-33_2023-05-22_12-42-33_136420_G000056_BN_IUKETH_0003_MGU_02_IOC_000_vigNextC dlt]_x000D_
_x000D_
system was normally running before the issue observed timestamp   _x000D_
_x000D_
The system stopped abruptly at timestamp [12:41:30]  and woke up after 3 sec with wakeup reason *CAN BUS ACTIVE *_x000D_
_x000D_
*!image-2023-06-05-18-28-33-708 png width=1142 height=28!*_x000D_
_x000D_
**MCU reset reason observed was *RESET REASON POWER ON* _x000D_
_x000D_
!image-2023-06-05-18-29-50-500 png width=1224 height=26!_x000D_
_x000D_
**From the above observations we can infer that MCU has lost power but RTC was working  This behavior is observed when the voltage has been dropped to a value which is sufficient for RTC but not for MCU   _x000D_
_x000D_
IOC has lost power during running state and when it gains the power back a wake up message is received from CAN which woke up the IOC with wakeup reason CAN_BUS_ACTIVE _x000D_
_x000D_
Why IOC has lost its power during runtime needs further analysis _x000D_

Conclusion from LC Focus group:_x000D_
 * Root cause -_x000D_
 ** Shortly after resume at 16:03 Safety internal shutdown   - So early in the start up    - To be checked by Safety team  _x000D_
 *** Crash due to the Safety violation hibernate reset when switch is still not powered up  which wouldn t reset/power the switch _x000D_
 *** Safety violation followed by hib reset will not apply the POR port configurations in the current implementation _x000D_
 * PR will be raised which would also cover the hib reset case when Eth switch is enabled  to apply POR port configurations to power the switch -  color:#4c9aff Viji Karthik color _x000D_
 ** To be tested extensively to check if all Eth service use cases are covered_x000D_
 ** Planned for 23/11 as per above comment_x000D_

So the switch power and switch did not follow a proper initialization sequence and hence the shutdown error reset _x000D_
_x000D_
The PR  [https://cc-github bmwgroup net/icgen5/idc-ioc/pull/5798]  would address this   _x000D_
_x000D_
The PR is basically resetting the port configuration to Power ON configuration when the switch was not running in the previous cycle   _x000D_
_x000D_
But  IMO changing the whole port pin configuration now is risky as this may have impacts to other modules due to unforeseen use cases   _x000D_
_x000D_

We can observe that the *APIX link was lost* before going to STR mode  This can be confirmed from the following logs; (En: Off indicates APIX is Off)_x000D_
_x000D_
  _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
139 2023/05/21 19:45:25 136499 375 1345 10 IOC DFED DFED 4116 log info non-verbose 0 [0]  DFE: desEn on  En off  desState FullOn  State full on_x000D_
267 2023/05/21 19:45:30 280109 380 1346 203 IOC DFE DFE 4112 log info non-verbose 0 [0]  Video not locked  Apix state: Off  Res: 1920x720_x000D_
 code _x000D_
Whenever APIX link is disconnected abruptly * En  will goes to  Off * state _x000D_
_x000D_
But * desState * and * State * will remain in  Full On  state as Apix link got unstable abruptly _x000D_
_x000D_
*desState * and * State *  will be updated properly if we get FULL-OFF/READY-DARK request from DISM _x000D_
_x000D_
Here the reason for Apix link getting unstable is not available  *The logs before the error timestamp should be attached to explain the reason for Apix going to OFF *_x000D_
_x000D_
Display is not going to *unintialised* state as Apixlink is lost and INAP is trying to establish Apixlink (So Displaycontroller state is switching between *ResetInap* and *InitialiseApix) *_x000D_
_x000D_
*Here inshort Apixlink is lost sometimes at the start of lifecycle but it is not visible in log *_x000D_
_x000D_
In the new lifecycle  as we can see from the logs  APIX link is getting established and video is getting locked without any issues _x000D_
_x000D_

From analyzing the IOC and SOC   logs during the issue timestamp_x000D_
_x000D_
SOC has requested an STR to IOC   After sending SOC to STR IOC waits for the FPN s to be inactive _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
1707 2023/05/15 10:29:44 309307 1480 3923 108 IOC LCM  4096 log info non-verbose 0 [18]  Client ID: Lcm_Master  Request: LCM_SHUTDOWN_REQUEST  argument: 17 43 6c 69 65 6e 74 20 49 44 3a 20 4c 63 6d 5f 4d 61 73 74 65 72 2c 20 52 65 71 75 65 73 74 3a 20 4c 43 4d 5f 53 48 55 54 44 4f 57 4e 5f 52 45 51 55 45 53 54 2c 20 61 72 67 75 6d 65 6e 74 3a 20 31 37_x000D_
1710 2023/05/15 10:29:44 309352 1480 3941 111 IOC LCM  4096 log info non-verbose 0 [3]  SHUTDOWN_SUSPEND_TO_RAM_ETHERNET_ON_GRACEFUL_OFF 53 48 55 54 44 4f 57 4e 5f 53 55 53 50 45 4e 44 5f 54 4f 5f 52 41 4d 5f 45 54 48 45 52 4e 45 54 5f 4f 4e 5f 47 52 41 43 45 46 55 4c 5f 4f 46 46_x000D_
1715 2023/05/15 10:29:44 481984 1480 4054 116 IOC LCM  4096 log info non-verbose 0 [14]  Client:Lcm_Master- SoCMM request:STR_MODE- Status:IN_PROGRESS 43 6c 69 65 6e 74 3a 4c 63 6d 5f 4d 61 73 74 65 72 2d 20 53 6f 43 4d 4d 20 72 65 71 75 65 73 74 3a 53 54 52 5f 4d 4f 44 45 2d 20 53 74 61 74 75 73 3a 49 4e 5f 50 52 4f 47 52 45 53 53_x000D_
1763 2023/05/15 10:29:45 143412 1481 1339 176 IOC LCM  4096 log info non-verbose 0 [13]  SoCMM current state: STR_MODE 53 6f 43 4d 4d 20 63 75 72 72 65 6e 74 20 73 74 61 74 65 3a 20 53 54 52 5f 4d 4f 44 45_x000D_
_x000D_
 code _x000D_
  But during this time SOC wakes up  _x000D_
 code:java _x000D_
57348 2023/05/15 10:30:08 382612 1482 1394 59 MGUA IOA IOAA 686 log info verbose 1 IOLifecycle: Send resumeFinished code _x000D_
So when SOC tries to send messages to IOC the INC UART is disabled as part of the STR request and will be only restarted when IOC requests for a handshake in the next Wakeup  As a result SOC does not get the response and hence the signal gateway crash _x000D_
 This issue is related to the spurious wakeup of SOC _x000D_
 Similar to https://asc bmwgroup net/mgujira/browse/HU22DM-114708  We are currently running some tests to confirm this   _x000D_
